title: Who Is Farhad Shakeri, Afghan Man Behind Alleged Iran Plot To Kill Trump
content: Farhad Shakeri, an Afghan national who was deported from the United States in 2008, has been accused of plotting to assassinate Donald Trump.
summary: Farhad Shakeri, an Afghan national who was deported from the United States in 2008, has been accused of plotting to assassinate Donald Trump.

title: 21 Killed, 46 Injured In Railway Station Blast In Pakistan
content: At least 21 people were killed and 46 others injured on Saturday in a powerful bomb explosion at a crowded railway station in Pakistan's restive Balochistan province.
summary: At least 21 people were killed and 46 others injured on Saturday in a powerful bomb explosion at a crowded railway station in Pakistan's restive Balochistan province.

title: Opinion: Trump 2.0: Doubling Down Or Back To Zero?
content: As Trump prepares to saunter to the White House yet again, it is worthwhile to quote John Wayne, the famous Hollywood Wild West icon: "A man deserves a second chance, but keep an eye on him."
summary: As Trump prepares to saunter to the White House yet again, it is worthwhile to quote John Wayne, the famous Hollywood Wild West icon: "A man deserves a second chance, but keep an eye on him."

title: 'Khalistani Terrorist Threatened Us': Australian Outlet Facing Canada Ban

title: Indian Official Meets Taliban Minister, Ex Afghan President Hamid Karzai
content: In a significant move, an Indian delegation met Afghanistan's acting Defence Minister Mullah Mohammad Yaqoob and offered the use of Chabahar Port in Iran to businesses in his country, and also discussed extending humanitarian assistance to Kabul.
summary: In a significant move, an Indian delegation met Afghanistan's acting Defence Minister Mullah Mohammad Yaqoob and offered the use of Chabahar Port in Iran to businesses in his country, and also discussed extending humanitarian assistance to Kabul.

title: Oxford University Student Committed Suicide Due To 'Cancel Culture', Probe Finds

title: Musk's Net Worth Surpasses $300 Billion After Trump's US Election Win

title: Pak PM Shehbaz Sharif Congratulates Donald Trump On X, Gets Community Noted

title: Pak Shuts Parks, Museums As Air Quality Worsens, Multans AQI Crosses 2,100
content: Pakistan's Punjab government in a bid to combat the hazardous smog conditions in the province, shut down amusement parks and museums for 10 days, from November 8 to 17, ARY News reported.
summary: Pakistan's Punjab government in a bid to combat the hazardous smog conditions in the province, shut down amusement parks and museums for 10 days, from November 8 to 17, ARY News reported.

title: After US Election Loss, What's Next For Kamala Harris?
content: Kamala Harris will demit office in 72 days and has no immediate plans as far as her political career is concerned.

title: Amid India-Canada Diplomatic Rift, Justin Trudeau's "Khalistani" Admission

title: "Dark Moments In History...": Biden On Attacks On Israeli Fans In Amsterdam
content: US President Joe Biden on Friday (local time) condemned the recent attacks on Israeli soccer fans in Amsterdam Friday, calling the incident "despicable and echo dark moments in history when Jews were persecuted."

title: Geomagnetic Shield Weakening Over North America, Claim Chinese Researchers

title: Heat, Air Pollution, Disease: How Climate Change Affects Health
content: Record-breaking heat, extreme weather events, air pollution and the spread of infectious disease: climate change poses an already vast yet rising threat to the health of humans around the world, experts warn.

title: Myanmar's War-Torn Rakhine Faces Famine With 2 Million People At Risk: UN
content: Myanmar's war-ravaged Rakhine state could face imminent famine according to a United Nations report, which estimates that more than two million people could be at the risk of starvation.

title: Authorities Probing Bigoted Text Messages That Spread Alarm Across US
content: Federal and state authorities are investigating a wave of bigoted text messages sent anonymously that have spread alarm among Black Americans across the country this week, officials and recipients told Reuters.
